meanings.definition: An unborn or unhatched offspring in the process of development.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the embryos under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: The bird carefully nested her embryos to keep them warm.
meanings.sent3: The embryos in the eggs seemed to be having a party, wiggling around.
meanings.sent4: The embryos of ideas in his mind slowly grew into fully formed plans.
meanings.sent5: The embryos of the flowers bloomed into a beautiful garden.

meanings.definition: A rudimentary or undeveloped form of something.
meanings.sent1: The artist sketched the embryos of his painting before adding details.
meanings.sent2: The embryos of the plan were just rough sketches on paper.
meanings.sent3: The embryos of the story were like puzzle pieces waiting to be put together.
meanings.sent4: The embryos of innovation often start with simple ideas.
meanings.sent5: The embryos of talent in the young musician showed great potential.
